title: Scree Plot and Component Selection
description: Interactive visualization for learning to use scree plots and cumulative variance to select the optimal number of principal components in PCA analysis.
creator: Claude AI
subject: Linear Algebra

learningObjectives: Interpret scree plots to identify natural dimensionality of data
Apply the elbow method to select number of principal components
Set and justify variance thresholds for component selection
Understand and apply Kaiser criterion for standardized data
Recognize when dimensionality reduction is appropriate
Evaluate trade-offs between compression and reconstruction quality

controls.label: Components (k)
controls.description: Number of principal components to keep (1-10)

controls.label: Show Elbow
controls.description: Highlight detected elbow point on scree plot

controls.label: Show Reconstruction Error
controls.description: Display reconstruction error bar showing variance kept vs lost

controls.label: Threshold Drag
controls.description: Draggable handle to interactively adjust variance threshold

visualElements: Scree plot bar chart of eigenvalues

Explore scree plot and component selection through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of scree plot and component selection to solve problems
